intro: Bombax rurrenabaqueanum, commonly known as the Rurrenabaque ceiba, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy, white flowers that bloom in clusters. The tree can grow up to 30 meters tall, with a massive, buttressed trunk and broad, palmate leaves. Its fibrous bark and cotton-like seeds are notable features, though the plant is not widely cultivated outside its native habitat.
